column4: i cant connect to wireless, i see "wireless is disabled by hardware switch". the only hw switch i know is a fn-hotkey that shows no reaction
my thinkpad has a physical switch for on/off hardward wireless, don't know about HP
i only have a fn+f12 hetkey, the led indicates its off. cant figure out how to switch it on
don't think so, it worked in windows
did it work before and suddenly not?
i haven't used it in quite some time and not at all on ubuntu. it did work a while ago on win7
might be that there is no support yet for HP fn key, just a guess
how would i enable it then?
i had this problem with debian, couldn't adjust screen brightness, was very annoying
probably not that then, i'm out of suggestions, good luck
i don't know, i remember that at the beginning the wifi was always on. i might have switched it off, but i don't rememeber where -.- any idea? ^^
on my thinkpad, if I boot up with the wifi switch off, turning it on after Ubuntu is running doesn't activate it
maybe it was off during boot up, and the driver for your wifi didn't get loaded, I'd try rebooting with the wifi on
